answers.answer: I really didn't notice any symptoms maybe the only thing was being tired after eating alot of sweets
Yes it's all about sugar levels. I had it w/ first pregnancy and had to prick my finger 3-4 times a day to make sure my levels were within the right range.
Oh are we talking about before or after being diagnosed with it

I want to no about before and if sugar effected you at al because when i seem to drink a sugary drink or eat something sugary i feel like my heart beats faster feel alll funny faint and lightheaded and sometimes like im getting hot flushes so just wondering if ive got it im going to speak to my midwife tomorrow about it

I have it the only real symptoms I've had when it was high is feeling very very tired and having to pee alot more. It sounds like yours is dropping cause that's how I feel when mine would drop which might be happening because when you eat or drink something sugary its causing it to go real high and then drop very quickly. Talk to your midwife she will probably want to test you or give you tips on how to keep it from dropping.
Ohh and when you start to feel that way you need to eat something most likely a Carb maybe toast or a sandwich nothing real sweet tho. Orange juice is good to.

question: How do you no if you have gestational diabetes? Are there any signs or way or knowing like does sugar effect you in anyway?
title: Gestational dibeties?
